file_content.text: You have done a great service, Jedi. Thank you.
I am pleased to see you return from Kaleth.
Forgive me for my impatience, but I would ask: Did you power the machine chamber? Was there anything there?
The machine created a hologram--made by the old Tythonians, I think. It gave me a data archive.
It was fascinating.
Just this crystal--some sort of storage device.
Not very much.
I found more than you ever did digging through dirt out here.
Yes--unlike some people.
We must each pursue our own methods. May I see what you have?
Astonishing--this is a Tythonian data crystal. I've never seen one intact.
This is a magnificent find, my friend. Do you know what it contains?
A reminder of what the Jedi Order could be. An echo of our potential.
Inspiration.
Knowledge to help us defeat our enemies.
A weapon.
A daring statement. I hope you speak truly.
The wisdom of an old philosopher.
Knowledge.
Memories of peace, and of a gentler age.
A better past.
How interesting. Something to look forward to, then.
No idea.
Then I hope you'll return to me a few years from now, and we can find out together.
Now go--achieve great things. I have my own humble mission to attend to.
Come back when you've returned power to the machine chamber of Kaleth.
Rest here, my friend. The air is cold, and the mountain paths are treacherous.
Words are unnecessary when the Force is with you.
What's a Jedi doing all the way out here?
Who are you?
I'd like to hear your words anyway.
Please, talk.
Then stay and we will speak a few moments.
My name is Do Zonn.
Believe it--the Force is strong in me.
You can see my power.
Is it? When a rock is swept down a flooded river, is the speed in the rock or in the water?
But forgive me--you didn't seek my view, and I have not introduced myself. I am Do Zonn.
I stand watch over Kaleth, and I walk the paths surrounding its grounds. I meditate upon my failure, and I learn of our past.
What do you mean by your "failure," Do Zonn?
Your failure?
Research?
Kaleth was the capital of the ancient Tythonian culture. Here, the old lords sought to balance their power.
You must live an exciting life.
How dull.
I accept my path.
As a Padawan, I came to Kaleth. Here, I touched temptation and the dark side.
Having failed once, I now act through other Jedi. Many help me find knowledge of ancient Tython.
Your mission sounds like a noble one.
It seems worthwhile.
The search for knowledge always leads to light.
A wise approach.
You know the Jedi Code well.
I'd like to assist.
I am humbled by your offer. Thank you.
The task is difficult but also... calming. I look at Kaleth from afar, but never touch. By trusting others to walk where I cannot, I broaden my perspective.
So you were tempted once, and now you're afraid to return to Kaleth. Sounds to me like you're a coward.
You're pitiful.
I'll meditate on your wisdom. In the meantime, however, would you entertain a request?
Lately, I've learned of a chamber hidden in Upper Kaleth--one central to a Tythonian machine. I'd very much like to restore the chamber's power.
What sort of machine is this chamber part of?
What does it do?
Go on.
That can't be smart.
The old scrolls describe it as a place of knowledge and speech. Beyond that, I don't know its function... but it should do harm to no one.
Without energy, the chamber has slept for millennia. Yet there are droids in the ruins that still function--and you might use their power cells to fuel the machine.
It's a good suggestion. I'll do what I can.
If I can, I will.
Sounds like a long shot.
The power cells are compatible, but I can't say what will happen once they're installed.
That's a lot of effort for some old machinery.
All for a mystery chamber?
It's your choice, Jedi.
You're certain, however, that the mystery of this chamber is best left untouched?
You've got me curious. All right--I'll go restore power to the machine chamber.
I can't resist.
Oh, all right.
Then go and tend this electric garden. Plant the droids' seeds in the soil of the machine.
Together, we'll bring the Tythonians' secrets to light.
Not my duty. [Refuse quest]
I thank you for hearing me out. May the Force be with you.
Are you certain you're ready to be in Kaleth?
These are the ruins of Kaleth. Pass with the Jedi's blessing.
